question.title: Will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Arizona officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will NASA's Orion capsule complete a crewed return mission from the ISS by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, NASA's Orion capsule successfully completes a crewed return mission from the International Space Station (ISS) to Earth. For a positive resolution:

1. The mission must involve the Orion capsule transporting at least one human crew member from the ISS back to Earth.
2. The capsule must land safely with all crew members in good health.
3. The mission's success must be officially confirmed by NASA or another authoritative space agency.
4. The confirmation must be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, CNN, New York Times).

The question will resolve as NO if:
- No such mission occurs by the specified date.
- A mission is attempted but fails to meet all the above criteria.
- The Orion capsule is used only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return flight.

Note: This question does not consider test flights or simulations. Only actual crewed return missions from the ISS count towards resolution.

- The Orion spacecraft is utilized only for uncrewed missions or launches to the ISS without a return trip.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to cut the FDA's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?

question.title: Will Elim Chan be recognized as the youngest music director of a major orchestra by July 2024?

The tribe in question is the Kickapoo Traditional Tribe of Texas. Completion of the first phase must be confirmed through official announcements by the tribe or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). Completion implies that the drone delivery infrastructure is established and ready for operation, even if full service has not yet begun. If the first phase of the project is not completed by December 31, 2024, or if there is insufficient evidence of its completion, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Darden Restaurants announce plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Darden Restaurants (the parent company of Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, and other restaurant chains) officially announces plans to acquire The Cheesecake Factory. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements, regulatory filings (such as SEC filings), or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal). The announcement of intent to acquire is sufficient for a YES resolution; the acquisition does not need to be completed by this date. question.title: Will Belarus withdraw its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Belarus publicly announces the withdrawal of its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from the Belarusian government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The withdrawal must be a clear and unambiguous retraction of Belarus's application to join the organization, not merely a postponement or reconsideration. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if Belarus joins the organization before the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Bloomberg Philanthropies announce a $600 million donation to historically Black business schools by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of historically Black business schools. The announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers) or through official statements from Bloomberg Philanthropies or the recipient institutions. The donation must be specifically intended for the endowments of these business schools. question.title: Will AbbVie allow generic production of its rheumatoid arthritis drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, AbbVie officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its rheumatoid arthritis drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if AbbVie continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Texas state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Texas regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially organizes a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a positive outcome:

1. The public vote must be formally announced and carried out by the Texas state authorities.
2. The public vote must directly relate to the matter of protecting abortion rights.
3. The results of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communication or reputable news outlets.

The inquiry will be answered with a NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is cancelled or delayed past the mentioned date.
3. A public vote is conducted, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not evaluate the result of the public vote, only whether it occurs within the designated timeframe.

The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if IBM only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

para_P.title: Is IBM expected to reveal intentions to expand its AI workforce by December 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by December 31, 2024, IBM makes a public declaration regarding its intentions to grow its AI workforce. This declaration must be communicated through official company channels (like press releases, statements to investors, or verified social media accounts) or covered by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or the Wall Street Journal). The statement regarding the increase in AI workforce must be clearly articulated and not merely deduced from broader hiring strategies. If there is no such declaration by the specified deadline, or if IBM only states plans to keep or reduce its AI workforce, the inquiry will be considered negative. It is important to note that this question pertains to the announcement of plans rather than the actual execution of those plans.

question.title: Will Moscow announce a public transit-only policy for its 2026 World Cup venues by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or an official representative of the city government announces a policy stating that all venues for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be accessible only by public transportation. The announcement must be made through official channels (such as a press conference, official statement, or city government website) or reported by at least two major news outlets. The policy should explicitly state the intention to restrict private vehicle access to World Cup venues, promoting the use of public transit instead. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announced policy allows for any significant exceptions to the public transit-only rule, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a declaration regarding a public transport-exclusive policy for the venues of the 2026 World Cup in Moscow by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, the Mayor of Moscow or a designated representative of the municipal government makes a declaration indicating that all locations for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will only be reachable via public transportation. The declaration must be issued through official means (such as a press conference, formal statement, or the city government’s website) or covered by at least two major news organizations. The policy should clearly express the intent to limit access to World Cup venues for private vehicles, thereby encouraging the use of public transport. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the stated policy permits any considerable exceptions to the public transport-only requirement, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Will a major AI research lab's chatbot be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major AI research lab's chatbot is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI research lab's chatbot and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on marijuana legalization by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on marijuana legalization. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address marijuana legalization, either proposing to legalize or to restrict its use. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on marijuana does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

question.title: Will Oscar Mayer issue a recall of hot dogs due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?

question.title: Will Marta Rovira return to Spain and face a trial related to the 2017 Catalan independence referendum by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Marta Rovira returns to Spain and is officially put on trial for her involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Rovira physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. The charges must be directly related to Rovira's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. If no such trial begins by the specified date, or if Rovira is granted immunity or amnesty that prevents a trial from occurring, the question will resolve as NO. The resolution of this question is not dependent on the outcome of any potential trial.

question.title: Will Massachusetts hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Massachusetts state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.

3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

question.title: Will Russia report a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia officially reports a bumper harvest for both wheat and sunflowers, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or TASS). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either wheat or sunflowers) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Sweden announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Swedish government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Prime Minister's office or the Ministry of the Environment, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Sweden will reveal intentions to construct more nuclear reactors in addition to the existing two by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, the Swedish government makes an official declaration regarding the construction of additional nuclear reactors beyond the two currently proposed. The declaration must originate from an official governmental entity, such as the Prime Minister's office or the Ministry of the Environment, and must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The declaration must explicitly express a commitment to build more reactors beyond the two already planned, rather than merely discussing expansions or changes to the current plans. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the declaration merely reiterates or updates the existing two-reactor proposal, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Indonesia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Indonesia officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank Indonesia communications, such as press releases, Board of Governors statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which is the Central Bank of Indonesia's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: Is an announcement of an interest rate reduction by the Central Bank of Indonesia expected by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Central Bank of Indonesia makes an official declaration regarding an interest rate reduction that is set to take effect by August 31, 2024. The confirmation must come through official communications from Bank Indonesia, including press releases, statements from the Board of Governors, or public addresses by Bank officials. If there is no such declaration by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the BI 7-day reverse repo rate, which serves as the primary monetary policy tool of the Central Bank of Indonesia.

question.title: Will France's CAC 40 index reach or exceed 7,500 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, France's CAC 40 index reaches or exceeds 7,500 points. The 7,500 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Euronext Paris. If the index does not reach 7,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 7,500 points.

para_P.title: Will the CAC 40 index of France hit or surpass 7,500 points before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, at any moment from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, the CAC 40 index of France hits or surpasses the 7,500 point mark. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from trusted financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or Euronext Paris. If the index fails to reach 7,500 points during this timeframe, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index is not required to close at or above 7,500 points.
